full_summary:
**Ground Penetrating Radar (GPR) Request for Proposal (RFP)**

**Reference Number:** cb-776-90980048  
**Amendment Number:** 3  
**Solicitation Number:** M5000-23-3139/A  
**Publication Date:** May 17, 2024  
**Tender Closing Date:** June 18, 2024 (16:00:00)  
**Amendment Date:** June 18, 2024  
**Expected Contract Start Date:** August 21, 2024  
**Expected Contract End Date:** December 21, 2024  

The Royal Canadian Mounted Police, D Division located in Winnipeg, Manitoba, invites proposals for the supply and delivery of a Ground Penetrating Radar (GPR).  
All deliverables must be received on or before August 21, 2024.  
This solicitation contains a security requirement.

**Selection Criteria:**
A bid must comply with the requirements of the bid solicitation and meet all mandatory technical evaluation criteria to be declared responsive. The responsive bid with the lowest evaluated price will be recommended for contract award.

**Submission Instructions:**
Proposals must be submitted electronically to the RCMP Bid Receiving Unit at: NWR_Procurement_Bids@rcmp-grc.gc.ca  
Refer to the attached tender documents for further information.

**Procuring Office:**
Royal Canadian Mounted Police  
Procurement and Contracting Division  
5th Floor, 10065 Jasper Ave, Edmonton, Alberta T5J 3B1  

Canada retains the right to negotiate with any supplier on this procurement.  
Documents may be submitted in either English or French.  
The RCMP has adopted the Integrity Regime administered by Public Services and Procurement Canada.  

Canada will make available Notices of Proposed Procurement (NPP), bid solicitations, and related documents for download through the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) at https://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities . Canada is not responsible for the information found on third-party websites.  
It is the sole responsibility of the Bidder to regularly consult GETS for the most up-to-date information.

**Indigenous Procurement:**
The federal Indigenous Business Directory (IBD) is an online resource for all levels of government and the private sector to identify Indigenous business capacity.
